line.token: * Page for Signing Up to Campaign Monitor List
* Each page relates to one CM list.
"Page to suscribe and review newsletter list(s)"
* Campaign monitor pages that are ready to receive "guests"
"Ask your developer on how to add more templates"

'

To create a new mail out go to

'

Each sign-up page needs to be associated with a campaign monitor subscription list.

'
'Allow users to sign up to all lists'

'A start form is a form where people are just required to enter their email address and nothing else. After completion they go through to another page (the actual CampaignMonitorSignUpPage) to complete all the details.'
'Sign up form intro (e.g. sign up for our monthly newsletter ...'
'Sign up button label for start form (e.g. register now)'
'Sad to see you go message after submitting form'
'Show old newsletters? Set to "NO" to remove all old newsletters links to this page. Set to "YES" to retrieve all old newsletters.'

'

Unfortunately, newsletter lists are not automatically linked to individual newsletters, you can link them here...

'
'<h3>You can also view individual campaigns - here is <a href="'
//remove subscription list IDs from other pages
* you can add this function to other pages to have a form
* that starts the basic after which the client needs to complete the rest.
* Or does a basic sign up if ajax submitted.
//user_error("You first need to setup a Campaign Monitor Page for this function to work.", E_USER_NOTICE);
* adds a subcriber to the list without worrying about making it a user ...
* name of the list connected to.
* tells us if the page is ready to receive subscriptions
* add old campaings or remove them

'

Enter your email to sign up for our newsletter

'
"You can not suscribe to this newsletter at present."

* returns a bunch of stats about a campaign
